N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 440.2 - Not-for-profit corporation requirements

State Regulations
(a) A not-for-profit corporation must
demonstrate to the satisfaction of the office that it is capable of operating
and maintaining the completed project for the benefit of the public. The
following documents will be required in the grant application to verify a
corporation's not-for-profit, tax-exempt status and provide evidence of such
capability: (1)
a copy of the corporation's
certificate of incorporation issued by the New York State Department of State
or the New York State Board of Regents; and
(2)
a copy of a determination letter from the

United States Internal Revenue Service verifying the corporation's tax-exempt
status. (b) Prior to
entering into a project agreement verification will be required to demonstrate
that the not-for-profit corporation is up-to-date with all pertinent filing
under section 501 of the United States Internal Revenue Code, and either
article 7-A of the New York Executive Law, or section 8- 1.4 of the New York

Estates, Powers and Trusts Law, or section 1508 of the New York Not-for-Profit

Corporation Law, or section 215 of the New York Education Law. Notes
